name: Clin T Pancreas Other
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  Islets of Langerhans are distributed throughout the pancreas; an islet tumor is coded to the subsite of the pancreas in which the tumor arises if the information is available.

**Note 2:**  Islets of Langerhans are distributed throughout the pancreas; an islet tumor is coded according to the subsite of the pancreas in which the tumor arises if the information is available.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 4:**  For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Confined to pancreas
    Localized, NOS
rows:
Clinical evaluation performed but unknown results or extension not stated
Clinical evaluation performed but results not documented in patient record
Size is part of the T definition and the size is not available but information states that the tumor is confined to the primary site

In situ, intraepithelial, noninvasive 
Pancreatic Intraepithelial Neoplasia III (PanInIII) 
PanIN-III classification
Tumor limited to pancreas, 2 cm or less in greatest dimension
Tumor limited to pancreas, more than 2 cm in greatest dimension

Tumor extends beyond pancreas, but 
WITHOUT involvement celiac axis or superior mesenteric artery

Adjacent large vessel(s) 
    Colon

    Stomach

Peripancreatic tissue

Aorta

Further contiguous extension
